Class Transaction

LMDB Transaction. A thread can only use one transaction at a time, plus any child transactions. Each transaction belongs to one thread.

Inheritance

Namespace: KdSoft.Lmdb
Assembly: KdSoft.Lmdb.dll
Syntax
public class Transaction : IDisposable
Remarks

There can be multiple simultaneously active read-only transactions but only one that can write. Once a single read-write transaction is opened, all further attempts to begin one will block until the first one is committed or aborted. This has no effect on read-only transactions, however, and they may continue to be opened at any time.

Methods

Abort()

Abandon all the operations of the transaction instead of saving them. Same as Dispose(). The transaction handle is freed. It and its cursors must not be used again after this call, except with mdb_cursor_renew(). Note: Earlier documentation incorrectly said all cursors would be freed. Only write-transactions free cursors.

Declaration
public void Abort()

CheckDisposed()

Returns Transaction handle. Throws if Transaction handle is already closed/disposed of.

Declaration
protected IntPtr CheckDisposed()
Returns
Type Description
IntPtr

Commit()

Commit all the operations of a transaction into the database. The transaction handle is freed. It and its cursors must not be used again after this call, except with mdb_cursor_renew(). Note: Earlier documentation incorrectly said all cursors would be freed. Only write-transactions free cursors.

Declaration
public void Commit()

Committed()

Called at end of commit, at this point the transaction is already closed/disposed.

Declaration
protected virtual void Committed()

Dispose()

Abandon all the operations of the transaction instead of saving them. Same as Abort(). The transaction handle is freed.It and its cursors must not be used again after this call, except with mdb_cursor_renew(). Note: Earlier documentation incorrectly said all cursors would be freed. Only write-transactions free cursors.

Declaration
public void Dispose()

Dispose(Boolean)

Implementation of Dispose() pattern. See Dispose().

Declaration
protected virtual void Dispose(bool disposing)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Boolean disposing

true if explicity disposing (finalizer not run), false if disposed from finalizer.

ReleaseManagedResources(Boolean)

Releases/closes managed resources - like cursors - owned by the transaction. Thread-safe. Part of Dispose() pattern.

Declaration
protected virtual void ReleaseManagedResources(bool forCommit = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Boolean forCommit

true if transaction is closed/disposed due to a commit, false otherwise.
